document.masterDocTitle: The species of Adelencyrtus Ashmead and Epitetracnemus Girault (Hymenoptera: Encyrtidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The species of Adelencyrtus Ashmead and Epitetracnemus Girault (Hymenoptera: Encyrtidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Female. Body length 1.1−1.5 mm . Body dark brown with a metallic green or blue sheen; mesoscutum and scutellum with green-blue reflections; Body dark brown with a metallic green-blue sheen; antenna (
Fig. 61
) generally dark brown except apex of clava, F 5 and F 6 yellow or F 5 sometimes yellowishbrown; fore wing with infuscate pattern as in
Fig. 62
; fore leg dark brown except apices of coxa, femur and tibia yellow; mid leg (
Fig. 63
) dark brown except basal 1 / 3 of femur, apical 2 / 3 of tibia, tibia spur and tarsus yellow; hind leg dark brown, except apices of tibia and tarsus yellow.

Hosts. Many species of Diaspididae (see
Noyes 2002
).
Epitetracnemus intersectus
was also recorded as a parasitoid of
Pseudaulacaspis pentagona
by
Qu et al. ( 1994 )
, but this host record probably results from a misidentification of
E. comis
.

Distribution. Very broadly distributed (see
Noyes 2002
); recorded from China by
Trjapitzin ( 1978 )
.

Material examined. CHINA : Beijing,
3 .vii. 1955
, coll. D.X. Zhang ( 3 ΨΨ). Fujian, Fuzhou,
23 .ii. 1963
, coll. X.F. Zhao ( 1 Ψ). Guangxi, Jiangkou,
27 .v. 2002
, coll. Y .Z. Zhang ( 1 Ψ); Napo,
30 .iii. 1998
, coll. C.D. Zhu ( 1 Ψ). Hebei, Weichang,
11 .v. 1985
, coll. H.F. Mi ( 1 Ψ). Liaoning, Dalian,
20 .i. 1978
, coll. G.T. Xu ( 1 Ψ); Shenyang, 1991 , coll. J.X. Lou ( 1 Ψ).
